findings.title: Unencrypted Private Data On-Chain
findings.description: Access to Critical Private Variable via Public Method (CWE-767)

findings.title: Message call with hardcoded gas amount
findings.description: Hardcoded gas amounts can lead to unexpected behavior and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Hash Collisions with Multiple Variable Length Arguments
findings.description: The finding indicates a vulnerability where hash collisions can occur due to multiple variable length arguments, potentially leading to authentication bypass via capture-replay attacks.

findings.title: Presence of unused variables
findings.description: Unused variables are present in the codebase.

findings.title: Right-To Left Override control character (U+202E)
findings.description: The Right-to-Left Override (RLO) Unicode character U+202E can manipulate the visual representation of text, potentially leading to phishing attacks or other security issues.

findings.title: Arbitrary Jump with Function Type Variable
findings.description: The finding indicates a vulnerability where an arbitrary jump can occur with function type variables, potentially leading to unintended behavior.

findings.title: Requirement Violation
findings.description: Improper Following of Specification by Caller

findings.title: Missing Protection against Signature Replay Attacks
